name: Bilateral Trigeminal Cavernous Hemangiomas
chief_complaint: I have severe facial pain that feels like electric shocks, and sometimes my vision gets blurry

lab_results.MRI with contrast: bilateral enhancing lesions in cavernous sinus with trigeminal nerve involvement
lab_results.MRA: compression of intracavernous ICA without flow limitation

prognosis: Guarded - lesions tend to progress slowly but can cause permanent cranial nerve deficits. Pain control is challenging.
description: Rare vascular malformations involving both cavernous sinuses with direct trigeminal nerve compression. The bilateral presentation suggests a possible underlying vascular developmental anomaly. Lesions demonstrate characteristic 'berry-like' enhancement pattern on MRI with flow voids indicating high vascularity.
